column5: Wow, that sucks.  Hope you're feeling a bit better.  No laughing or sneezing okay.  Take care Dave.  Joey
Not the best way to end a day that's for sure, hope you're feeling better soon and good luck finding the jacket.  Maureen
brokwen ribs suck! speedy recovery!  do not laugh or sneeze
CAME HOME TODAY AND FOUND MY JACKET ON MY DOOR STEP>   My license iin my fron pocket with my addy still on it..   MANY MANY THANKS to who ever left it..  Dave
Now thats KHARMA!!!
That's GREAT News!!!!!    :thumbsup_anim:     Kudos to whoever returned it!  Maureen

Got a message on my telephone from the guy who found the jacket..   said he saw me rolling down the steps and he also called 911 when I didnt wake up at first...  His name is Bill Muller   MANY MANY THANKS BILL  MAY THE FISHING GODS BLESS YOU WILL A RECORD FISH   DAVE
Hope you get better soon Dave
That's horrific.  I was there 2 weekends ago for the MS walk, most participants had a hard time navigating the stairs along the bridge. Glad to here that you're alright.

Just got off the phone with Dave he slipped and fell 19 steps at the Humber today. He has 2 broken ribs and a concution but the new rod and reel (Raven) are doing fine. Dave has been a very good friend to me so l have to be the first to wish him a speedy recovery and if l have to l will push him in a wheel chair to make sure he is at the Trout opener. Heal well Dave and thanks for being a great Bud. Peace Ken
Ouch!!!!Hope you get well soon.Try not to sneeze. Joe
OOOHHH..  Bummer!  Glad the rod and reel are okay though.  God speed and full recoup man.  tight loops  HD
That's scary stuff, best of luck to Dave and the hopes for a speedy recovery.
Oh man...thanks for the news!  We'll all be thinking of him.....I have a feeling though that with a good tape job for the ribs, he'll be out there slaying trout next weekend!
LIKE EVERY GOOD STEELHEADER HE SAVED HIS ROD AND REEL FIRST  LOL HOPE FOR A QUICK RECOVERY BRO!!!
fast recovery and hope you get out for opener...
Wish you a speedy recovery Dave. Let me offer you and Ken a smooth ride on the Bog for a relaxing day of crappie fishing. just what the doctor ordered.  Team Five is alive  Cheers Al
oh nooo, hope u recover faster than u fell

Sorry to hear about your unfortunate accident...  I hope you're well enough to make the opening...  I salted the minnows you gave me last February and if all else fails next weekend for crappie...I'll give them a try...
Funny stuff!!!  On the serious side, get well soon and best of luck!
Get well soon Dave.
Ouch,those ribs are the worst .....Here's to hoping for a speedy recovery with no ill effects.....TC all and tight lines.....Chuck
Sacrifice the ribs for the rod and reel!! Same for a beer though I guess! All the best for a speedy recovery.
Thats a tumble I'll say, wow.  By the sounds of it, coulda been much worse too.   Speedy recovery there Dave.
Not to make light of this terrible accident, but I do concur that the man has his priorities right!  Here is wishing for a speedy recovery!
Doesn't he work for Raven?  If he was in the process of going fishing, couldn't he claim this as a work related injury?  Get well soon

WOW THANKS OFC'ERS  Funny thing about today I was going home to shower for work and I forgot my jacket in the park , so I went back to the Humber and took the stairs by the Bloor bridge, slipped and fell 19 stairs.  Fishing today was great, managed 4 good trout and 10 suckers....  Pics to follow..   THANK GOD FOR PERKS LOL  Thanks all  Dave
Found your jacket? Take care.
Well at least it happened AFTER fishing!!!  Wishing you a speedy recovery!!
that sucks.  sorry to hear it.  hope you're on your way to a full recovery.  take care -d-
Wishing you a speedy recovery as well! Hope to see you out there again soon!
Those steps are tricky,they move without giving warning. LOL Sorry.  Speedy recovery.
Take care buddy.  Here's to a speedy recovery.
Hello  If anyone finds a Orvis wading jacket please return it to me at Al Flaherty's (416) 651-6436  I was on my way down to the river where I left it... Dave
